name: IoT Production Process
description:
Demo Messaging

The expectations of customers, and business partners alike, are rising rapidly as the world becomes increasingly digitized. A Connected Customer Experience is the new driver for disruption. Companies are not only being challenged by customer expectations, but also by rising production costs, regulatory compliance and increasing complexity of IT infrastructure. At the same time, they are forced to reduce operational costs and drive new business models, innovation, and mainly digital transformation.


Manufacturers are especially being faced with the constant struggle of increasing revenue while decreasing costs to serve. To support this digital transformation projects, products are getting smarter, as are the factories that make them. The Internet of Things (IoT) is the key enabler for this. According to analysts, they expect an investment in (Industrial) IoT of 60 trillion USD in the next 15 years.

  • How do you check if your operation is running as it should?
  • How do you check if your processes are working in a harmonized manner across all factories of your company?
  • How do you identify the effects of IoT events on your overall process?

Only 5% of all transformation initiatives result in performance improvements. Most of digital transformation projects are considered a failure after they have been completed according to forbes.com. And the main reason for this is that less than 10% of all companies have insight driven practices. That means for IoT projects of manufacturers, only 12% of these projects have been fully successful completed.
